description: After installing the security updates associated with CVE-2024-20674, users may notice authentication issues within their Windows environments. Specifically, an authenticated attacker can bypass the Kerberos authentication feature, leading to potential impersonation of users or systems within a network. This could manifest as unexpected access to sensitive resources or applications, with users experiencing difficulties in maintaining secure transactions. Administrators must be vigilant as this critical flaw allows an attacker with low privileges to exploit systems across various Windows build numbers, including 10.0.19044.3930 and Windows 11 Version 21H2 (10.0.22000.2713). Affected KB Article IDs include KB5034134 and KB5034121, which detail the necessary steps to remediate this significant vulnerability.
